section.title: Module
section.para: The module enables you, on behalf of your company (the beneficiary) to receive notification of remittances, and subsequent updates, from the Remitting Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval or acceptance in the ongoing transaction flow.

section.title: Inward Remittance Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

listitem.para: Send a free-format message to the Remitting Bank regarding an Inward Remittance that the bank has notified you of. A typical use of this feature could be for you to state your acceptance of the documents presented by the remitter and his Remitting Bank.
Check for a list of your inward remittance transactions that are pending on the Bank's system.
View all existing inward remittance transactions, according to a specific search criteria.
Maintain Unsigned, Purged and Rejected inward remittances.

section.title: Inward Remittance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Inward Remittance function, from the toolbar, select Account Services > Inward Remittance.

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This section describes the Message to Bank part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: Message to Bank Option
section.para: This part of the menu contains several functions, providing different ways to send a free-format message to the Remitting Bank.
A typical use is to notify the Remitting Bank of receipt of a fund transfer.

section.title: From Existing IR
section.para: Displays a list of existing Inward Remittances, that is, Inward Remittances that your company (the beneficiary) has received notification from the Remitting Bank.

section.title: Edit Transactions
section.para: Review, complete and submit records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Review and submit records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Message to Bank - From Existing IR
section.para: When this function is selected, a list of existing inward remittances is displayed and you can communicate with the Bank.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Reference, Remitter Name or Currency field.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of inward remittances are the following:

entry.para: Unique reference number generated for for this file, when it was initiated.
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Identifier the bank uses for this remittance

section.para: The input form for you to enter the details of the free-format message is as follows:

entry.para: (Button at the right-hand side of the General Details title line.) Open a popup window to show the full details of the current Inward Remittance.
Unique reference number that was generated by for this Inward Remittance when it was created.
Reference assigned by the bank's back office to this Inward Remittance when the bank created the IR.
Text of your message to the bank.
Up to 100 lines of 65 characters each.
Text field and Browse button, which you can optionally use to attach a file from your local hard disk to give additional details pertaining to this message.

note.para: The maximum size allowed for each file attachment is defined in a properties file.

section.title: Message to Bank - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows an inward remittance message to a bank that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of IR messages to bank that have been prepared and saved by users, but not yet submitted to the bank because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Message to Bank - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows the completion of an inward remittance message to a bank that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit.

When selected, this option will present a list of IR messages to bank that have been prepared and saved by users, but have not been successfully submitted to the bank because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the message in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Pending IRs
section.para: When this function is selected, a list of existing Inward Remmitance Transactions that have not yet been submitted to the remitting bank is displayed. This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, or Remitter Name field.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also Download File button where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.

The columns returned in the list of Inward Remittance Transactions are the following:

section.title: IR Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain inward remittance records that were created, but are no longer required in the system. It has one option: Action Required.

When this function is selected, a list of existing Inward Remittance Transactions from the remitting bank is displayed. This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Bank Ref., Remitter Name or Currency field.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: IR Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: Assign an entity to an IR record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no entity assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign an entity to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: IR Maintenance - Unsigned IRs
section.para: Display a list of IRs that have been prepared by users in your company but that have not yet been submitted.
Some of these records may be out of date and will never be submitted. A client user with administrator's privilege should delete these pending records.

You can delete multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. The Delete selected transactions button at the end of the page deletes all the selected records.

section.title: IR Maintenance - Purged IRs
section.para: Select the Purged IRs option from the left side navigation menu to list and optionally delete Inward Remittance transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Further amendments or messages cannot be initiated on such a transaction, and can only be used for data inquiry purposes. One or more records can be deleted in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page. (if the company does not have a direct connection to the bank's system, messages to purge invoices are sent by the bank to the users system by other means such as SWIFT TSU).
